snippet: Sergeant Bergdahl, the lone American prisoner of war from the Afghan conflict, has been released in exchange for five Taliban prisoners at Guantánamo Bay.
abstract: Sgt Bowe Bergdahl, lone American prisoner of war from Afghan conflict, is released to American forces in exchange for five Taliban detainees held at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba; Taliban detainees are flown from Cuba in custody of officials from Qatar, who are accompanying them back to that Persian Gulf State, where they will be subject to security restrictions.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and CHARLIE SAVAGE
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Singapore, and Matthew Rosenberg from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Sergeant Bergdahl, the lone American prisoner of war from the Afghan conflict, has been released in exchange for five Taliban prisoners at Guantánamo Bay.

headline.sub: Five Prisoners Will Be Released From Guantánamo Bay
headline.main: Bowe Bergdahl, American Soldier, Freed by Taliban in Prisoner Trade
headline.print_headline: American Soldier Freed by Taliban in Prisoner Trade
